items.title: Flat Architecture
items.description: Single-layer design: tokens defined once in tokens.scss, used directly in components. No component-specific variables. Each component has one .scss file with reset and base styles. All styling controlled via layer-first CSS tokens.

details.concept: Single-layer design: tokens defined once in tokens.scss, used directly in component SCSS
details.no_abstraction: No component-specific CSS variables (e.g., --button-bg). Components use design tokens directly (e.g., var(--forms-background))
details.single_file_per_component: Each component has one .scss file containing reset and base styles
details.token_styling: All visual styles controlled via token overrides - no style attributes needed

items.title: Unit-Based Tokens
items.description: All dimensions derive from --unit (6px default) and --ratio (0.4 default). Change --unit to scale entire UI: 4px=compact, 6px=standard, 8px=spacious. Derived tokens: --forms-height, layer-specific padding/gap/radius/border/background.

details.core_principle: All dimensions derive from --unit. Change --unit to scale entire UI proportionally.

items.title: Build System
items.description: npm run build compiles SCSS to CSS and bundles TypeScript. Output: dist/core.css + dist/core.js. Source organized in five numbered folders: 1-shell, 2-layout, 3-component, 4-forms, 5-content.

build_scripts.build: npm run build - Compiles SCSS to CSS and bundles TypeScript

source_structure.core/2-layout/: Page regions (area, section, toolbar, sidebar, header, footer, nav-*, grid)
source_structure.core/3-component/: UI containers (accordion, toast, table, badge, tag, nav, icon)
source_structure.core/4-forms/: Form elements (button, input, select, textarea, checkbox, radio, range, tabs, label)
source_structure.core/core.scss: SCSS entry point (imports tokens + all layers + resets/animations/utilities)

items.title: Usage
items.description: Import core.css and core.js. Override CSS tokens on any container to change styles for all children. Works with any framework.

details.customize_tokens: Override CSS tokens on :root, body, or any container to cascade style changes to children
details.style_modes: Set layer tokens (--shell-*, --layout-*, --component-*, --forms-*) on any element to control all children

items.title: Frontend App
items.description: Svelte 5 documentation app in frontend/ folder. Two pages: Welcome (landing) and Components (showcase). Uses Nav.svelte for navigation, imports lib web components (<nuke-icon>, <nuke-tabs>, etc). Serves as dogfooding environment to test lib components.

items.title: 5-Layer Architecture
items.description: Five layers matching folder structure: 1-shell (app frame), 2-layout (page regions), 3-component (UI containers), 4-forms (form elements), 5-content (typography). Each layer has independent tokens. core.scss contains resets, scrollbar, animations, utilities.

layers.1-shell: App frame - overall page structure (app-shell-sidebar, app-shell-stacked)
layers.2-layout: Page regions - areas, sections, navigation containers
layers.3-component: UI containers - accordions, toasts, tables, badges, tags
layers.4-forms: Form elements - buttons, inputs, selects, checkboxes, radios
layers.5-content: Typography - headings, lists, paragraphs, links, code

details.core_scss: Resets, scrollbar styling, global states, animations, utilities

items.title: Layer-First Token Naming
items.description: Tokens use layer-first naming: --shell-gap, --layout-padding, --component-border, --forms-height. Each layer has: padding, gap, radius, border, background. No cascade between layers - each is independent.

items.title: Block vs Island Mode
items.description: Two aesthetic modes controlled by layer tokens. Block mode (--*-gap: 1px, --*-radius: 0, --*-border: none): Japanese hairline aesthetic - body color shows through 1px gaps creating visual borders. Island mode (--*-gap: 5px+, --*-radius: 3px+, --*-border: 1px solid): floating card aesthetic - visible separation, rounded corners, explicit borders.

items.title: Forms Padding Calculation
items.description: Form elements (buttons, inputs, etc.) don't use padding tokens. Instead, padding is calculated from height and ratio: padding = forms-height × (1 - ratio). This ensures consistent proportions across all form element heights.
